molecular.title: Analyse the results of a Brownian dynamics simulation for calculating protein-protein association rate constants
molecular.description: Analyse the results of an SDA Brownian dynamics simulation to calculate the rate constant of Gαolf associating to adenylyl cyclase 5, and estimate the error in this prediction via bootstrapping.

molecular.title: Calculate the electrostatic potential of a protein from its atomic structure
molecular.description: Use the multipipsa package to assign atomic charges and radii to a protein structure then solve the Poisson-Boltzmann equation to calculate its electrostatic potential in aqueous solution.

files.entryname: Calculate the electrostatic potential of a protein from its atomic structure

molecular.title: Compare the electrostatic potentials surrounding a set of protein isoforms with multipipsa
molecular.description: Use the multipipsa package to compare the electrostatic potentials of nine isoforms of the enzyme adenylyl cyclase and cluster the isoforms by electrostatic similarity.

files.entryname: Compare the electrostatic potentials surrounding a set of protein isoforms with multipipsa

molecular.title: Compare a specific region of the electrostatic potentials surrounding a set of protein isoforms with multipipsa
molecular.description: Use the multipipsa package to compare the electrostatic potentials of nine isoforms of the enzyme adenylyl cyclase, at a specific site on their surfaces, and cluster the isoforms by electrostatic similarity in this region.

files.entryname: Compare a region of the electrostatic potentials of a set of protein isoforms.

molecular.title: Identify potential protein binding sites by comparing the electrostatic potentials of a set of protein isoforms
molecular.description: Use the multipipsa package to compare the electrostatic potentials of nine isoforms of the enzyme adenylyl cyclase at many sites on their surfaces. The electrostatic similarities at these sites is compared to known isoform-specific regulation patterns for the inhibitory protein , to predict the likely binding sites of regulatory proteins.

files.entryname: Identify potential protein binding sites of a set of protein isoforms

molecular.title: Predict protein interaction surface with the ARDOCK server
molecular.description: In silico analysis of your protein surface using molecular probes to reveal potential interaction sites

molecular.title: Preparing a protein to run an atomistic Molecular Dynamics simulation
molecular.description: Running a Molecular Dynamics setup from a protein in PDB format to obtain a system ready to be used as input for an MD simulation. Using GROMACS MD package and the building blocks library from the BioExcel project.

files.entryname: Prepare environment for Notebook "Preparing a protein to run an atomistic Molecular Dynamics simulation"
Preparing a protein to run an atomistic Molecular Dynamics simulation

molecular.title: Small molecule force field parameterization for atomistic Molecular Dynamics simulations
molecular.description: Generate force field (GAFF) parameters for a small molecule in PDB format to use it in atomistic Molecular Dynamics simulations. Using ACPype, Ambertools and OpenBabel programs, and the building blocks library from the BioExcel project.

files.entryname: Prepare environment for Notebook "Small molecule force field parameterization for atomistic Molecular Dynamics simulations"
Small molecule force field parameterization for atomistic Molecular Dynamics simulations

molecular.title: Preparing a protein-ligand complex to run an atomistic Molecular Dynamics Simulation
molecular.description: Running a Molecular Dynamics setup from a protein-ligand complex in PDB format to obtain a system ready to be used as input for an MD simulation. Extending the use case 1 (MD setup) adding a small molecule. Using GROMACS MD package and the building blocks library from the BioExcel project.

files.entryname: Prepare environment for Notebook "Preparing a protein-ligand complex to run an atomistic Molecular Dynamics Simulation"
Preparing a protein-ligand complex to run an atomistic Molecular Dynamics Simulation

molecular.title: Preparing a membrane protein to run an atomistic Molecular Dynamics Simulation
molecular.description: Running a Molecular Dynamics setup from a membrane protein in PDB format to obtain a system ready to be used as input for an MD simulation. Extending the use case 1 (MD setup) adding a nuclear membrane. Using GROMACS MD package and the building blocks library from the BioExcel project.

molecular.title: Generating small molecule conformations from Replica Exchange Molecular Dynamics (REMD)
molecular.description: Running a Replica Exchange Molecular Dynamics (REMD) for a small molecule in PDB format to obtain an ensemble of conformations ready to be used as input for docking simulations. Extending the use case 2 notebook. Using GROMACS MD package and the building blocks library from the BioExcel project.

molecular.title: Extracting relevant information from atomistic Molecular Dynamics trajectories of relevant signal transduction proteins using MoDEL_CNS API
molecular.description: Use case showcasing several useful examples of how to extract, play, store, and visualize information from the atomistic MD trajectories stored in the MoDEL_CNS database.

molecular.title: Set up a Brownian dynamics simulation for calculating protein-protein association rate constants
molecular.description: Starting from a structure of the complex formed between adenylyl cyclase 5 and Gαolf obtained from a molecular dynamics simulation, set up all the files required to perform a Brownian dynamics simulation with SDA.

molecular.title: Tools to search and analyze molecules
molecular.description: Use cases to simulate, analysis and visualize molecules

subcellular.title: KappaNEURON demonstration
subcellular.description: A simple example use case of how to use KappaNEURON for a calcium pump

subcellular.title: Subcellular application
subcellular.description: Web based environment for creation and simulation of reaction-diffusion models

files.entryname: BuildOwn Single HippoCell - NSG Job Manager

singlecellmodeling.title: Mono compartmental Cerebellar Granule cell optimization
singlecellmodeling.description: Using BluePyOpt to optimize a single compartmental cerebellar granule cell. All the parameters, channels and morphology can be modified. This version runs directly on the collaboratory and it is limited to small optimizations

files.entryname: Mono compartmental Cerebellar Granule cell optimization

singlecellmodeling.title: Multi compartmental Cerebellar Granule cell optimization
singlecellmodeling.description: Using BluePyOpt to optimize a multcompartmental cerebellar granule cell composed by four dendrites, soma and a custom multi segmented axon. All the parameters, channels and morphology can be modified. This version runs directly on the collaboratory and it is limited to small optimizations

files.entryname: Multi compartmental Cerebellar Granule cell optimization

singlecellmodeling.title: Custom Axon Cerebellar Granule cell simulation
singlecellmodeling.description: The purpose of this usecase it to explain how to setup an axon, built with BluePyOpt, containing an erbitrary number of sections. Afterward to simulate an actual cerebellar granule cell model with an axon composed by over 300 sections.

files.entryname: Custom Axon Cerebellar Granule cell simulation

singlecellmodeling.title: Simulation and validation of a mouse Purkinje cell multicompartmental model
singlecellmodeling.description: Simulation and validation of a mouse Purkinje cell multicompartmental model obtained from BluePyOpt optimizer. The purpose of this usecase it to extract, simulate and validated a series of physiologically correct Purkinje cells. This notebook runs directly on the Collab and does not require HPC resources

singlecellmodeling.title: Optimize a striatal fast-spiking interneuron
singlecellmodeling.description: Fit parameters of a striatal fast-spiking interneuron model to the experimental data. Optimization uses BluePyOpt as well as the realistic morphology, channel kinetics and extracted neurophysiological features. This version runs directly on the collaboratory and it is limited to small optimizations.
